name: Janet's Chicken Casserole
author: Janet Allison
summary: This is a creamy delicious chicken casserole that can be served by itself or with a salad as a complete meal. It is very simple to make and very delicious! Individual servings can be warmed in the microwave as this makes a good size casserole. Enjoy!
ingredients: 16 ounces herb-seasoned dry bread stuffing mix
2 (10.75 ounce) cans  condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
8  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cooked
directions: In a medium bowl combine the melted butter or margarine and dry stuffing mix
In a large bowl mix together the cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, mayonnaise and sour cream
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
To Layer Casserole: Spread peas, carrots and 1/2 of the mushrooms in the bottom of a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish
Sprinkle 1/2 of the stuffing over the vegetable layer and press lightly with hand to compress
Ladle the chicken broth over the stuffing evenly
Next spread 1/2 of the soup mixture evenly over the stuffing
Add the chicken and spread to cover completely
Pour remaining soup mixture over all and top with remaining stuffing and slivered almonds
Cover dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour
Remove foil and bake for another 15 minutes
Remove dish from oven, cover once more with foil and let stand about 20 minutes before cutting into individual pieces and serving
